conclusion: Determine the time for a charged particle to complete a semicircular path in each magnetic field and return to point O.
The radius of the circular path of a charged particle in a magnetic field is given by r = mv/qB.
In B1, the radius r1 is r1 = mv/qB1.
In B2, the radius r2 is r2 = mv/qB2.
The time T for a complete circle in a magnetic field is T = 2πm/qB.
The time for a semicircle is T_semi = πm/qB.
In B1, the time for a semicircle T1 is T1 = πm/qB1.
In B2, the time for a semicircle T2 is T2 = πm/qB2.
The total time T_total is T_total = T1 + T2 = πm/qB1 + πm/qB2.
The time it takes for the particle to pass through point O downward again is 3πm/(2qB2).
